definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: I was like a keeper in the zoo distributing half-rations among magnificent animals.
sentences.chinese: 在分配折半的口糧給一些巨大的動物喫。

sentences.english: They may also be put on half-rations.
sentences.chinese: 他們也會被削減一半配額的口糧。

sentences.english: He docked the workers off part of their rations.
sentences.chinese: 他減少了工人們的部分口糧。

sentences.english: Rations were served to the troops.
At once we encouraged visiting soldiers to carry rations with them on home visits.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我們立刻鼓勵士兵隨帶口糧去作家庭訪問。

sentences.english: Workers' rations are diluted with honey and pollen.
sentences.chinese: 工蜂的口糧則是由蜂蜜和花粉稀釋了的王漿。

sentences.english: I don’t always use this as an emergency meal.
sentences.chinese: 我不大使用這個做爲緊急口糧。

sentences.english: I travel with some sort of emergency rations.
sentences.chinese: 所以我旅行時會帶些緊急口糧。

sentences.english: One Russian colonel had crowed that looted American rations were particularly tasty.
sentences.chinese: 一個俄羅斯上校曾說搶來的美軍口糧特別好喫。

sentences.english: He was ordered to serve round rations to the troops.
sentences.chinese: 他奉使給部隊分發口糧。

sentences.english: Middle & large size pet takes this product with pet food.
sentences.chinese: 中大體型愛寵請配合口糧餵食。

sentences.english: During their six- to 12-week voyages they lived on meager rations.
sentences.chinese: 在6到12周的航行中，他們依靠微薄的口糧生存。

sentences.english: Three-day supply of K rations, chocolate bars, charms, candy…
sentences.chinese: 三天份的口糧，巧克力棒，精力糖。

definition: proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
coupons for food or grain used in a PRC economic program c. 1955-1993
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
